channel.title: Beverages
channel.description:
Since we have a cannabis topic, let's post some our favorite beverages.
[img]http://www.cocktails.eu/data/photos/caribbean+pineapple.jpg[/img] I suggested this one to yackman the other day as it is one of my favorites: Malibu rum + pineapple juice.

item.title: Beverages
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

I seem to always be drinking jäger bombs so I suppose that’s my “signature drink” but my friend and I also made a drink of vanilla galleano and lemon squash, tastes like lemon cheesecakes

As for cider strongbow and seeds are the only ones I’ll ever touch, beside the dry strongbows, they’re ick

item.title: Beverages
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:35, topic:427482”]Honestly I am relieved. I put off even tasting the Johnny Walker Blue for over a year because I was scared I would fall in love with the > $200 per bottle scotch, turns out I am more of a $20-$30 dollar scotch man, much better for Mr. Wallet.

And when I say cheap beer, I don’t mean Natural Light cheap (haven’t bought that since college), I mean Miller Lite, Miller High Life, Labatt Blue, Budweiser, Blue Moon etc etc. I think it runs about $19 for a 24 pack, I haven’t bought alcohol in a really long time. :/[/quote]
Oh my god that Johnny Walker is good. I’ve only had it one time, but it was probably the best scotch I’ve had…

Read full topic

item.title: Beverages
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Honestly I am relieved. I put off even tasting the Johnny Walker Blue for over a year because I was scared I would fall in love with the > $200 per bottle scotch, turns out I am more of a $20-$30 dollar scotch man, much better for Mr. Wallet.

And when I say cheap beer, I don’t mean Natural Light cheap (haven’t bought that since college), I mean Miller Lite, Miller High Life, Labatt Blue, Budweiser, Blue Moon etc etc. I think it runs about $19 for a 24 pack, I haven’t bought alcohol in a really long time.

Read full topic

item.title: Beverages
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:33, topic:427482”][quote author=t4 link=topic=530180.msg3871041#msg3871041 date=1325346611]
what’s everyone’s opinion on cider, I’ve yet to try it? what names should I look for?
[/quote]

My favorite cider is Woodchuck, it’s delicious. Hornsby’s is good too, I haven’t had strongbow, though my friend likes it.

As far as drinks go, if made right Long Island Iced Tea’s are great, but I’ve also had awful ones too. It’s about 5 different shots of liquor mixed together, with a shot of Coca-cola as well, and if done right, you can’t even taste the alcohol, which really makes it dangerous too. You can drink far too much without realizing it.

I usually just stick to cheap beer though, (Miller Lite usually) and I saw some canadian mention Molson, I’ve never had it, but I really like Canadian Labatt Blue, jme got me to go out and try it years ago, the funny thing is it is actually cheaper in the USA here than in Canda. Sucks to have all those taxes.

When I’m not in the beer mood, I like Irish Whiskey or cheap scotch either straight or mixed with some soda, either coke or orange. My favorite Irish Whiskey would be Tullamore Dew, my favorite scotch would be either Johnny Walker Red or Black. Once I got a sample pack with Johnny Walker Gold, Green, and Blue, and as I tasted the more expensive ones, the worse tasting they got. A real scotch drinker would probably get mad at this, but when I finally go to finish them off one day (I’ve had them over 2 years now) I’ll probably end up mixing them with orange soda. :D[/quote]aaaaah blasphemy! Light beer AND cheap scotch? I am disappoint son

Read full topic

item.title: Beverages
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

t4:

what’s everyone’s opinion on cider, I’ve yet to try it? what names should I look for?

My favorite cider is Woodchuck, it’s delicious. Hornsby’s is good too, I haven’t had strongbow, though my friend likes it.

As far as drinks go, if made right Long Island Iced Tea’s are great, but I’ve also had awful ones too. It’s about 5 different shots of liquor mixed together, with a shot of Coca-cola as well, and if done right, you can’t even taste the alcohol, which really makes it dangerous too. You can drink far too much without realizing it.

I usually just stick to cheap beer though, (Miller Lite usually) and I saw some canadian mention Molson, I’ve never had it, but I really like Canadian Labatt Blue, jme got me to go out and try it years ago, the funny thing is it is actually cheaper in the USA here than in Canda. Sucks to have all those taxes.

When I’m not in the beer mood, I like Irish Whiskey or cheap scotch either straight or mixed with some soda, either coke or orange. My favorite Irish Whiskey would be Tullamore Dew, my favorite scotch would be either Johnny Walker Red or Black. Once I got a sample pack with Johnny Walker Gold, Green, and Blue, and as I tasted the more expensive ones, the worse tasting they got. A real scotch drinker would probably get mad at this, but when I finally go to finish them off one day (I’ve had them over 2 years now) I’ll probably end up mixing them with orange soda.

Read full topic
